Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever! Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: 46col_12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels across the world but this was by far the worst that I have experienced. Didn't have our booking so put us in the last remaining rooms, no air conditioning, bed bugs!, mattress which sunk in the middle, no toiletries. I ended up staying in my friends room as we had nowhere else to stay on a busy weekend - no refund. Receptionists are rude - always say "need to speak to our leader!" LOL! Jobs worths - feel really sorry for them as they obviously don't want to work in customer service. Another excuse is "come back in 3 hours". It's a joke. Owner would be better of throwing a load of bunk beds in every room and charge people £10 a night or have as a brothel. Could not even borrow a bottle opener - had to buy from the corner shop. Avoid, avoid, avoid!

Reviews.Title: “easy stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location 1 block to bus and metro routes. elevator and private bath for hostal rates staff not 100% english speaking, but enough to get points across and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hhollandd
Reviews.Content: We were 1 minute away from the Gran Via and 2 minutes from the metro station. A lot of shops and restaurants around, especially cafe la Luz was a favorite! The rooms are quite noisy though...

Reviews.Title: “I COULD NOT BELIEVE i WAS IN LIBERAL SPAIN”
Reviews.Author: Atleticoams
Reviews.Content: I travelled as Single to Madrid mainly for party and Nightlife. I always book a double room for two person in order to avoid discussion in case I take someone to my room and I expect from a hotel privacy. In this hotel, it was not possible. They would start a process of registration and ask my gust an ID. Second: Internet not only worked poorly, but was censored and blocked not only for adult content websites, but also for chatting/dating websites. I felt like I was in the former Soviet Union or the Poeples Republic of China. Besides these very personal dislikes, the hotel is not very clean, old, not very good maintained and for the price you can get much better places in Madrid. From the booked 4 nights, I left to another hotel after one and still wait for the refund of the other three nights.

Reviews.Title: “I found the dungeon; fortunately, the dragon disappeared.”
Reviews.Author: winniec1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Laris as it was the only room we could find for the Saturday of the EU football finals in Madrid. We paid over $200 US for a dingy room that, fortunately, was missing the dragon. The neighborhood left a lot to be desired, but the Laris is pretty well situated if you want to be in the center of Madrid - which we did. The desk clerk was polite and helpful and I didn't feel like I wasn't safe in the hotel. But, given a choice, I would not stay here again--even though the normal rates are quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy location, scruffy rooms, more like 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyColley
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Laris for our first 2 nights in Madrid and could not wait to leave. We booked using hotels.com so we got a good deal, but I would have been extremely annoyed if we'd paid full price. Whilst the location looks great on a map, in reality there are prostitutes everywhere and as soon as you step out of the hotel you can smell urine (we actually saw several people urinating in the street: under cars, against walls, in doorways - you name it). There is also a lot of grafitti, but this is true of Madrid as a whole. The hotel itself also had a funny smell in reception, not quite sure what it was. It smelt like some kind of cleaning product which should be a good thing but it was very overpowering and gave me a headache whenever we passed through! Our room and the corridors were also very scruffy (lots of peeling paint etc.): this hotel is in serious need of doing up. I would certainly not say it is a 3 star - this rating was obviously awarded to the hotel a while ago. Also, there were no English channels on the TV. The only bonus was that our room was very big. The biggest problem we encountered was that despite booking a double room we were allocated a twin; when we asked to move we were told that there were no double rooms left. The staff weren't very helpful, in fact they were quite abrupt and rude. I'm sure there are worse places to stay but I would definitely not return to the Laris.

Reviews.Title: “Like being grabbed by prostitutes and drug dealers? Go here!”
Reviews.Author: tlg87
Reviews.Content: Single male traveller in July 08, arrived in the area and the taxi driver said to me to be careful in this area. I thought "Yeah, I'm a big boy.." but after being grabbed by prostitutes and chased down the street by someone trying to sell me drugs, after 2 days of my 7 day stay, I was straight back to the airport and home to London. Hotel was OK, small pokey room but that was fine.. well-lit, air con, clean bathroom. Nice breakfast. Wish I had paid that bit more.....

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here! Horrible Place!”
Reviews.Author: newcombgirl84
Reviews.Content: This "hostal" was MUCH worse than I could have ever imagined! The location may have been "close to" the Gran Via; however, you had to walk down dark, alley-like streets filled with hookers, drug deals being made, suspicious people walking around. The TAXIS don't even want to go there. The police stopped us as soon as we arrived to tell us there were hookers, drugs, a BAD pickpocket problem, and theft of all types. The lobby is TINY and the elevator is only large enough for 1 person plus luggage at a time! The rooms were dingy, stuffy (and they refused to turn on the air conditioning), the walls were dirty, and I did not want to even try the bedding! One of our rooms had an odor of urine, and on the first floor, you could not open your window for fresh air because of the danger of theft / break-ins. We moved out the same night we checked in, because it was so awful -- and the hotel refused any sort of refund at all. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for people wanting to see Madrid”
Reviews.Author: soaps60
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend got me trip to see a real madrid match and she opted for this hotel by not really reading any reviews. It was only after I found out about the wonderful gift that I went on and looked. I was slightly worried to hear the negative points about the prostitutes & junkies so I braced myself for the worst!! Yes the street is VERY slightly off the main gran via and yes, there were prostitutes hanging about BUT they were extremely harmless and you would see them in plenty of other streets so dont let this put you off. I personally didnt see any junkies at all. I believe it is perfect for anyone who wants to get out and about and see madrid. We were very raely in the hotel but when we were they were very helpful, rooms were clean & brealkast was fine. The staff were so good and would get you anything you asked for, within reason. Perhaps the best thing is you are within walking distance of EVERYWHERE and if your not there is a metro right beside you!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a real recommendation”
Reviews.Author: -C-1-C-
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in earlier reviews, the distance to the Gran Via is a big plus. But, as also mentioned before, returning from your dinner means passing by several prostitues and junkies. Which was probably the only moment of the day we didn't mind some rain, (prostitues and junkies apparently aren't very fond of it either) The rooms were ok, fine for just spending your night and nothing more, not in the best condition but ok. (keep in mind this hotel is not the one of the most expensive hotels) The bathroom was not in the best condition either but there was all you need (bath, shower, toilet, etc) The staff was nice, but their english is terrible (don't try to ask for a weather forecast or a taxi in english). Even though the comunication didn't went very smooth, they were helpfull. I strongly recommend not to sign up for the breakfast, Madrid has an enourmous number of coffee and tea shops where they can provide you a breakfast for less money (including a fresh squeezed orange juice!)

Reviews.Title: “ok by me”
Reviews.Author: wad1311
Reviews.Content: First tme in Madrid a bit daunting when we pulled up but the room was clean and tidy and good enough for my wife and me.You dont go to Madrid to sit in your hotel room.The staff were very friendly and helpful.The ladies never bothered us at all and when we came in at midnight time we never felt intimidated.So on the whole the hotels fine and good enough for a base.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and average service”
Reviews.Author: Chabeli_ch
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in the other reviews, location is the best asset of this hotel ... Eventhough it is located in a neighbourhood with "putas", it is very central...the Gran Via ( Shopping, theatres) is right there around the corner ! As a Madrid lover, i really appreciate being so close from the center of this beautiful town. As for the hotel, it is really average...It has recently been refurbished - I was there in march 2007 - and the rooms look nice. The bathrooms are not big but functional... I always ask for a quiet room, as those on the street side can be very noisy... Madrid is a party party city ! I have had a couple times a nice little room with a nice private bathroom for around Euros 70.- or something. The breakfast is standard, but very nice... Last time Iberia lost my luggage, they were of great help to retrieve it! I recommend hotel laris... If you're in Madrid for the week end, I also recommend having a look at the Church of San Antonio de la Florida,located on the Paseo de la Florida (open on Sundays from 10-12) and having lunch at the restaurant next to it . This church is a unique item, where Goya painted the whole ceiling. The colors go from bright blue to black ( Goya suffered depression before he died). The restaurant next to it is specialised in barbecue chicken, excellent spanish cheese, and almond tart. ! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, but excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: williamdfr
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is a few yards (yes, you do have to pass some prostitutes - about three hanging out on a street corner)from the main street in Madrid, near the metro but within walking distance of most things a tourist wants to see in Madrid. The staff were very friendly. The first room they showed us was on the fifth floor, but smelt horrible. When we asked to change it was no problem and our first floor room was fine. Bathroom average, room small but ok. Only five Spanish tv channels. If you get a good price, as we did, about 60 euros, then go for it. You won't find better value so centrally.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, dirty, but cheap and close to Gran Via!”
Reviews.Author: xedonis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hostal Laris with my class in March 2005 for one night. The hotel was situated just one minute walk from the Gran Via, so in that sense it had a very good location. The drawback was that the neighborhood was a rather bad one, with hookers just around the corner. I wouldn't feel to safe walking alone to the hotel at night, and as I had a room overlooking the road beneath there was a lot of noise from drunks and the hookers. Entering the hotel, it seemed very nice with a small, but newly refurbished lobby with modern decor. Walking up the stairs (the hotel had one elevator, but it was occupied), the hotel begun to show that it was worn, and entering my room was a bit of a letdown. My room was actually quite large, with a (french) balcony overlooking the street and tv. However, as my pictures show, the room was very worn. The ceiling had a hole covered partially by a brown cardboard box, the toilet had a wooden cover that was ducktaped together, and the carpet was stained. As I was taking off the bedspread, I saw a pubic hair under the blanket, as well as several other hairs. As I was a little disgusted and wondered if they had actually changed the linen, I went down to the reception and explained the situation and requested a new blanket. The manager(?) didn't speak any English, so I explained in simple Spanish. He didn't take me very serious, and told me that they wouldn't clean the room before next morning. After 15 minutes, he called a friend who spoke English to translate what we said to each other. No help to get there. I had to wake my spanish-speaking teacher, and after 5 minutes I got a new blanket. I've never encountered such bad service... The next morning, the breakfast was actually quite good from the small buffet. Considering the price, the hotel was very good value, but the neighborhood, service, unclean and worn room lets down. I heard that many of the other rooms were newly refurbished, so maybe I was unlucky with my room. If you're just looking at a place to stay for the night at a very low price, maybe this is the place for you. Otherwise, no. I certainly wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FAB SPOT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in the dark the area did look a bit lonely. In the daylight we found the hotel to be 500m from the famous Gran Via and with it various shops, restaurants, the nearest metrio stop (Gran Via) and the sightseeing bus stop too. The area is a hive of activity on Friday/Saturday nights as there are several inemas and theatres close by. The hotel staff didn't speak much English but were friendly and helped us with our bags. The room itself was much more spacious than expected complete with television and had an immaculate bathroom. Would recommend didn't seem to be lacking anything the expensive hotels had

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but near prostitutes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, but 2 blocks over hookers hung out, on the way to the Gran Via. I was a little leary to leave the hotel at night to go anywhere. It is situated right near Gran Via, which is a huge shopping street in Madrid. We had a hard time getting the taxi drivers to give us a ride, because they thought this hotel was located in an unsafe neighborhood. Of course, I don't know if the taxi drivers were trying to get a kickback if they brought us to another hotel, but we had already reserved and paid for this hotel, so we had to go.
